creator: martin.engstrom@askus.se
text:
I have a JSP page which uses a class which accesses a local database through a 
JDBC connection. When I start Tomcat (standalone) maually this page and all 
other pages work perfectly but when Tomcat has been started as an NT service or 
by the task scheduler this JSP page causes Tomcat to hang. The NT service can't 
even be restarted. The computer has to be rebooted. The logs are not giving any 
clues. I've even tried using a wrapper bat-file with a custom CLASSPATH with 
little success.

I'll need some test case to fix this, otherwise, I'll mark the bug as 
WORKSFORME and assume some kind of problem with the JDBC driver.
Do you use the service installed by the installer, or is it the jk service ?
What do you mean by "Tomcat hangs" ? Does the VM crash ? Does the server stop 
responding ?
creator: remm@apache.org
martin.engstrom@askus.se
text:
Some more info - I'm using JDK 1.4. The JDBC driver is mm.mysql-2.0.7. The 
service was installed by the installer.

When I say that the server 'hangs' I mean that that it is not responding to 
HTTP requests but the VM doesn't crash (the process is still there). The JSP 
page is supposed to query a database and return a gif. This works fine when 
Tomcat is started manually but when I auto-start it the browser just waits 
infinitely (hourglass).

However, further tests show that Tomcat may not be causing the bug after all. I 
have now also tried the Resin standalone server and the Caucho MySQL JDBC 
driver and surprisingly I get the same result. I'm starting to suspekt the JDK. 
Maybe I should down-grade to 1.3.x...

I've had some problems with 1.4 myself.

Using Tomcat as a service uses JNI (using the jvm.dll). It is a very strange 
problem.
Since it's unlikely Tomcat could fix the problem, I'll mark the bug as invalid.
creator: remm@apache.org
